verses.verse: Then Job<WH347> answered,<WH6030>
"No doubt,<WH551> but you are the people,<WH5971> and wisdom<WH2451> shall die with you.<WH4191>
But<WH1571> I have understanding<WH3824> as well as you;<WH5307> I am not inferior to you.<WH3644> Yes, who doesn't know such things as these?
I am like one who is a joke<WH7814> to his neighbor,<WH7453> I,<WH7121> who called on God,<WH433> and he answered.<WH6030> The just,<WH6662> the blameless<WH8549> man is a joke.<WH7814>
In the thought<WH6248> of him who is at ease<WH7600> there is contempt<WH3940> for misfortune.<WH937> It is ready<WH3559> for them whose foot<WH7272> slips.<WH4571>
The tents<WH168> of robbers<WH7703> prosper.<WH7951> Those who provoke<WH7264> God<WH410> are secure,<WH987> who carry<WH935> their God<WH433> in their hands.<WH3027>
"But<WH199> ask<WH7592> the animals,<WH929> now,<WH3384> and they shall teach you;<WH5775> the birds of the sky,<WH8064> and they shall tell you.<WH5046>
Or speak<WH7878> to the earth,<WH776> and it shall teach<WH3384> you.<WH1709> The fish of the sea<WH3220> shall declare to you.<WH5608>
Who doesn't<WH3045> know that in all these,<WH3027> the hand of Yahweh<WH3068> has done this,<WH6213>
in whose hand<WH3027> is the life<WH5315> of every living thing,<WH2416> and the breath<WH7307> of all mankind?<WH376>
Doesn't<WH241> the ear try<WH974> words,<WH4405> even as the palate<WH2441> tastes<WH2938> its food?<WH400>
With aged<WH3453> men is wisdom,<WH2451> in length<WH753> of days<WH3117> understanding.<WH8394>
"With God is wisdom<WH2451> and might.<WH1369> He has counsel<WH6098> and understanding.<WH8394>
Behold,<WH2040> he breaks down, and it can't<WH1129> be built again. He imprisons<WH5462> a man,<WH376> and there can be no release.<WH6605>
Behold,<WH6113> he withholds the waters,<WH4325> and they dry up.<WH3001> Again,<WH7971> he sends them out, and they overturn<WH2015> the earth.<WH776>
With him is strength<WH5797> and wisdom.<WH8454> The deceived<WH7683> and the deceiver are his.<WH7686>
He leads<WH3212> counselors<WH3289> away stripped.<WH7758> He makes judges<WH8199> fools.<WH1984>
He loosens<WH6605> the bond<WH4148> of kings.<WH4428> He binds<WH631> their waist<WH4975> with a belt.<WH232>
He leads<WH3212> priests<WH3548> away stripped,<WH7758> and overthrows the mighty.<WH386>
He removes<WH5493> the speech<WH8193> of those who are trusted,<WH539> and takes away<WH3947> the understanding<WH2940> of the elders.<WH2205>
He pours contempt<WH937> on princes,<WH5081> and loosens<WH7503> the belt<WH4206> of the strong.<WH4206>
He uncovers<WH1540> deep things<WH6013> out of darkness,<WH2822> and brings out<WH3318> to light<WH216> the shadow of death.<WH6757>
He increases<WH7679> the nations,<WH1471> and he destroys<WH6> them.<WH7849> He enlarges the nations,<WH1471> and he leads them captive.<WH5148>
He takes away<WH5493> understanding<WH3820> from the chiefs<WH7218> of the people<WH5971> of the earth,<WH776> and causes them to wander<WH8582> in a wilderness<WH8414> where there is no way.<WH1870>
They grope<WH4959> in the dark<WH2822> without light.<WH216> He makes them stagger<WH8582> like a drunken man.<WH7910>
